intro: Anomatheca angolensis, commonly known as the Angola thornveld grass, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its erect, sparsely branched stem and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Anomatheca angolensis is adapted to arid and semi-arid conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
